data.title: Meh.
data.text: Ate here twice in my quest to find a good sushi place in Charlotte. Both times the rolls seemed to be made with low quality ingredients: crab stick, not crab meat; mushed up salmon vs. pieces of salmon. I would put it on par with the kind of sushi you'd pick up at Harris Teeter.

data.title: Outstanding Thai food
data.text: A little hole in the wall Thai restaurant. The appetizers , i.e gyoza, soup were delicious. The main menu  was extensive.   The service was excellent.  Highly recommend this little gem

data.title: Nice sushi choice
data.text: Had dinner here with a business group and didn't find anything to complain about. Really extensive, true Asian Fusion menu. Everything that we ordered from the appetizers (Gyoza and Edamame) to the sushi, tempura and fried rice dishes were all very good, prices are reasonable and the service was great. It was obvious that the locals agree based on the packed house and all of the take out orders that kept stacking up on the bar. Nice sushi choice if you're in downtown Charlotte!

data.title: Delightful Uptown Dining Experience
data.text: We were visiting family who insisted we join them for dinner at one of their favorite restaurants.  The atmosphere was inviting, the waitress was personal and the food................  We began our meal with a generous serving of Hot & Sour Seafood Soup which I highly recommend.  The waitress checked with us often but we never felt rushed.  We ordered several sushi rolls  (all delicious) but my favorite was the Cherry Blossom.  A second round of sushi along with sashimi were ordered.   My husband loved the sashimi!  Looking forward to our next opportunity to visit Charlotte and Room 112.

data.title: Best sushi every day. Service great
data.text:
There are a few sushi places which knock it out Thursday thru Saturdays, but Room 112 is great every day (except Sunday, when closed). The two main sushi chefs and the own are very open to making a sushi roll or sashimi plate to yr request. 
I eat here 1-3x/month average.
Also, the pad Thai is excellent, and on the sl sweet side. I've only had the shrimp or tofu version.

data.title: Very good!
data.text: Working out of town with some coworkers and we wanted sushi. Room 112 is in a fun, downtown location. It's an adorable little spot, kind of crowded inside but definitely worth it. The sushi was very good, the lettuce wraps appetizer was fantastic! Definite recommendation!

data.title: Good Asian Food at a Good Price
data.text:
I'll disclaim this review by saying that I'm kind of an asian food snob.  But I'm a firm believer that there is some of the best chinese/japanese/fusion/etc to be had at a nice restaurant, served quickly, and at a good price.  Room 112 fits that bill!

I ordered the wonton soup, the sezchuan chicken plate, and a spider roll for under $20. Despite being very busy, my waiter had my table of four in and out of there in under an hour.  To top it off, the food was pretty darn good for what you paid for it!  I'll definitely be returning.

Warning to the wise:  they don't take reservations at lunch, so be prepared for a wait. (We arrived at 12 pm and they had us seated in 10 minutes, so it's normally not too bad)

data.title: Excellent!
data.text:
We visited this place before a show at Blumenthal Performing Arts, and we were blown away. When we walked in the Chef personally greeted my nine year old daughter and gave her some Hello Kitty Stickers. 

We order the beef and asparagus appetizer to start.  It was probably one of the best things I've ever eaten!  After that we ordered sushi and it was amazing!  Some of the best sushi I've ever had.  The service and food were outstanding!  We will definitely be back!

data.title: Great Sushi and Spring Rolls
data.text: My wife and I were craving some Asian food and we got exactly what we were looking for here. The restaurant is a little crowded, but we were still comfortable. The prices were very fair as well considering it's right in the heart of downtown.

data.title: Great sushi uptown!
data.text: Enjoyed some very tasty sushi at Room 112 tonight with a colleague. A friendly and pleasant environment. Wasn't the quickest service ever but I'd go there again.

data.title: Hidden Gem at Trade and Tryon Uptown
data.text:
Eva took excellent care of us tonight. We ordered the Won Ton Soup, Hot and Sour Seafood Soup Seaweed Salad and House salad with dynamite ginger dressing. Then we ordered three different Sushi Rolls that were plentiful and delicious.
The beverages are also great. Next time you go uptown, you need to check Room 112 out.

data.title: Yes!
data.text: It was awesome!  Great service and amazing food.  We loved the feel and atmosphere . Our waitress was very sweet with excellent service . The food melted in your mouth.  The spring rolls and miso soup, the best I think I ever had! Great place!

data.title: Favorite sushi in Charlotte
data.text: This is definitely our favorite sushi and Chinese place in Charlotte. It's a must for us anytime we go to Charlotte. We usually just go with their recommendations on sushi and have never been disappointed.

data.title: Best food
data.text: It was the Best food, we had in North Carolina Center City.  The service was awesome,  place was really attractive and on top of all the bill was really low.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: It is not a big place, but they fill the space pretty efficiently.  Every roll we had was delicious - especially the sexy salmon...ended up ordering a 2nd round of that one!  Our server gave great recommendations and the service was fairly quick.  Sashimi was also generously portioned and excellent!

data.title: Chinese food below expectation
data.text:
Based on a friend's recommendation, went for lunch on a Friday with my wife. Menu looked great. We are not sushi fan, commenting on the Chinese food only. 
We ordered pad Thai and Szechuan shrimp. I have to say, they were terrible. Pad Thai was full of tomato ketchup and tested just like ketchup. The vegetables did not seem like they were fresh. The egg fried rice did not have any eggs, at last found 1 piece of egg. 
Service also was terrible. Waited 25 minutes for the food to come. Water was never refilled, had to ask. 

There are better places to eat Chinese in Charlotte downtown.

data.title: Great sushi variety
data.text: I dined here with my sisters to treat them to sushi for the first time.  It was excellent with a great variety of specialty rolls.

data.title: Best Sushi in town, but not the best servers.
data.text:
So, I've been a citizen of Charlotte for 3 years now. I was introduced to Room 112 by my roommate. I was never a sushi fan before this place, but alas I was transformed into a sushi lover. Everything on the menu is delicious whether it be the california roll, the 112, or the sexy salmon. My point is that I LOVE their food.

Bad News, I hate their servers. There is one girl there who does her job, and does it well. But the rest of the  serving staff seem to give a crap about their jobs or their general appearance in front of customers. Tonight we dined (My roommate, his girlfriend and I) and we had the male server who was tall and had a beard. First off, the Server walked up to my table and had his hands in his pockets and greeted us with a "Sup, can I get you something to drink". I've been in the food industry since I was 16 and have seen multiple servers fired for not greeting the customer the correct way. After giving us our drinks and taking our orders, the server left our table to go be on his phone for 15 minutes. We had empty glasses and watched as our apps got put in the window to sit. After starting our food, two more servers walked in and proceeded to drink their starbucks, gossip, and play on their phones. As we finished our meal we looked around wondering where our waiter was and noticed he was putting a tie on and watching the news. He also took 15 minutes to deliver our checks after we payed...

Moral of this review. I love their sushi, I will always want it, but I will never dine in again. 

Hope you guys have a better experience than me!

data.title: Nice place for lunch
data.text: Visited Charlotte on the weekend and stumble into this restaurant by chance. We were craving for Chinese / Asian food and the place were perfect.  The hot and sour soup was spot on. Quite good for Asian food with American twist.

data.title: We live in Charlotte...never knew this place existed!
data.text: This is a great little spot for sushi.  Although we live in Charlotte, we rarely go downtown (or, as we call it "Uptown").  Just walking around, enjoying the day, we saw the restaurant and decided to give it a shot for lunch.  The place was packed, and I can see why.  Great option for sushi in Uptown, right across the street from the Marriott Hotel and convenient to local theaters and museums
